alert.note: Alert for Lincoln; Socorro (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Dust Storm Warning issued February 26 at 12:15PM MST until February 26 at 2:15PM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a * Dust Storm Warning for... Southwestern Lincoln County in central New Mexico... East central Socorro County in central New Mexico... * Until 215 PM MST. * At 1213 PM MST, a dust storm was 12 miles northeast of Three Rivers, and was expanding northeastward. HAZARD...Less than a quarter mile visibility with damaging wind in excess of 60 mph. SOURCE...Satellite imagery. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. * This includes Highway 380 between Mile Markers 48 and 78. Locations impacted include... Carrizozo, White Oaks, Nogal, Jicarilla and Oscuro. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Dust storms create dangerous driving conditions with visibility reduced to near zero. If you encounter a dust storm, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake. Motorists should not drive into a dust storm. PULL ASIDE STAY ALIVE!
